meta.title: Custom Keyboard Collective – Django Backend E-Commerce
meta.type: Academic team project (Web Framework 2, Vanier College)

overview.summary: A Django-based backend project for a community-focused e-commerce platform centered around custom mechanical keyboards and components. This project was developed as a team for the Web Framework 2 course, using Django’s templating system and plain Django views.
overview.problem: Existing keyboard communities often separate product sales from user discussions, reviews, and community feedback, leading to fragmented user experiences.
overview.solution: A centralized Django application that combines product listings, user accounts, reviews, and comments, enabling both commerce and community interaction within a single platform.

responsibilities: Worked primarily on the backend as part of a team-based academic project
Designed and implemented core backend architecture using Django and its templating system
Built Django models for products, categories, users, reviews, and comments
Implemented authentication and authorization using Django’s built-in auth system
Integrated Stripe for payment processing and implemented all Stripe webhooks
Handled local media storage for product images during development
Developed server-rendered views using plain Django views and templates

architecture.approach: Monolithic Django application using server-rendered templates and plain Django views, developed collaboratively with a strong emphasis on clarity, maintainability, and academic best practices.
architecture.data_flow: Product, user, review, and comment data are stored in a relational database; images are served locally during development; Stripe handles external payment processing while order data and webhook events are managed internally.
architecture.deployment: Currently not deployed. Deployment and production configuration are planned as future work.

key_features: Product and category management for keyboards and components
User authentication using Django’s built-in auth system
challenges_and_learnings: Collaborating on a shared codebase in a team environment
Designing a backend that balances e-commerce functionality with community features
Structuring Django models to support reviews and user interactions cleanly
Implementing and testing Stripe payments and webhooks
Managing local media storage during development
Planning for future scalability while working within academic constraints
future_improvements: Deploy the application to a production environment
Migrate media storage to a cloud-based solution
Enhance moderation tools for reviews and comments
Improve performance and pagination for large product catalogs
Expand community features such as ratings aggregation and user profiles
